p: Paterson et al. ( 2017) considered Malaysia and Indonesia separately and a similar pattern was observed with a dramatic decrease in HSC by 2100, from marginal and suitable climate areas. HSC decreased by 100% in Indonesia, whereas unsuitable, marginal, and suitable increased by 36%, 98%, and 96%, respectively, by 2100. In Malaysia, HSC decreased by 271%, whereas marginal and suitable increased each by 100%. Unsuitable climate decreased by 70%. Overall, there is a general decrease in HSC to less suitable climate which will have a detrimental effect on yields, including a probable increase in diseases from additional climate stress (Paterson et al., 2013).
